alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 4:27PM CDT until March 31 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Clark County in southwestern Arkansas... Northwestern Dallas County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Hot Spring County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 427 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Richwoods, or near Arkadelphia, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Gum Springs in Clark County... Richwoods... Joan... Tulip... Willow... Curtis... Dalark... Griffithtown... Manning... TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
